intro: Tithymalus depauperatus, commonly known as the poorflower, is a small, delicate annual plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It has a short growing season and is known for its pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in early summer. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
